perturbation.original_text: 1. Required Production. The Company shall produce no less than forty (40) original episodes of the Show per year;
perturbation.changed_text: 1. Required Production. The Company shall endeavor to produce approximately forty (40) episodes of the Show per year. The exact number of episodes is subject to the Company's resources and scheduling constraints.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a minimum of 40 episodes. The modified text uses 'endeavor to produce approximately,' making the number of episodes discretionary and dependent on resources. This creates a conflict, as one clause guarantees a minimum, while the other allows for flexibility, creating uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: 15. Payment of Money. In consideration of the services to be rendered under this Agreement as set forth above, the Company shall be  entitled to compensation in the amount of $150,000.00 (One Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars), to be paid in equal installments of $37,500.00  (Thirty Seven Thousand Five Hundred Dollars) on January 1, 2008, April 1, 2008, July 1, 2008 and October 1, 2008. If Cano fails to make any  payment when required by this Agreement, the Company shall have the option of canceling this Agreement following the passage of ten  (10) days after having given Cano written notice of its default. While the Company shall have no further obligation to Cano following  cancellation of the Agreement, Cano shall remain liable for all unpaid installments for the then current term of the Agreement, which  installments shall be immediately due and payable.
perturbation.changed_text: 15. Payment of Money. In consideration of the services to be rendered under this Agreement as set forth above, the Company shall be  entitled to compensation in the amount of $150,000.00 (One Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars), to be paid in equal installments of $37,500.00  (Thirty Seven Thousand Five Hundred Dollars) on January 1, 2008, April 1, 2008, July 1, 2008 and October 1, 2008. If Cano fails to make any  payment when required by this Agreement, the Company shall have the option of canceling this Agreement following the passage of ten  (10) days after having given Cano written notice of its default. While the Company shall have no further obligation to Cano following  cancellation of the Agreement, Cano's liability for unpaid installments will be subject to good faith negotiation and mutual agreement based on the actual value received by Cano prior to cancellation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that upon cancellation due to non-payment, Cano remains liable for all unpaid installments. The modified text introduces a 'good faith negotiation' element, making the amount owed uncertain and dependent on the value Cano received, directly contradicting the original clear obligation to pay all remaining installments. This introduces a potential legal dispute over the amount owed after cancellation.

perturbation.original_text: 4. Use of Logo. The Company agrees that the Cano logo and slogan shall appear on the primary boat and vehicle used in each episode.  Cano recognizes and agrees that it does not and will not have exclusive rights and that other sponsor's logos may appear on the primary  boat and vehicle. The Company agrees that Cano's logo shall be substantially the same size as other such sponsors;
perturbation.changed_text: 4. Use of Logo. The Company agrees to use its best efforts to ensure the Cano logo and slogan appear on the primary boat and vehicle used in each episode. Cano recognizes and agrees that it does not and will not have exclusive rights and that other sponsor's logos may appear on the primary boat and vehicle. The Company makes no guarantees regarding the prominence or visibility of Cano's logo relative to other sponsors.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the Cano logo 'shall appear' on the boat and vehicle, implying a guaranteed placement. The modified text uses 'best efforts' and explicitly disclaims guarantees regarding prominence or visibility. This creates a contradiction, as the first sentence suggests a firm obligation, while the second undermines that obligation, leading to uncertainty about the level of commitment for logo placement.
